Autostart.Name: Autostart
Autostart.Action: EventGhost.ShowOSD(u'EventGhost with \nstandard testcases \nfor Nodo Due', u'0;-64;0;0;0;400;255;0;0;0;3;2;1;34;Arial', (0, 0, 255), None, 4, (0, 0), 0, 5.0, False)

Folder.Name: Test case 4: send and receive "old" KAKU signals

Macro.Name: Test case 4: send and receive "old" KAKU signals

Action.Name: Send KAKU A1 on and off

Macro.Action: Serial.Write(u'EventlistWrite; KAKU A2, ON; SendKAKU A1, ON;')
Serial.Write(u'EventlistWrite; KAKU A2, ON; SendKAKU A1, off;')
Serial.Write(u'EventlistWrite; KAKU A2, ON; SendKAKU A1, ON;')
Serial.Write(u'EventlistWrite; KAKU A2, OFF; SendKAKU A1, Off;')
Serial.Write(u'EventlistWrite; KAKU A2, OFF; SendKAKU A1, On;')
Serial.Write(u'EventlistWrite; KAKU A2, OFF; SendKAKU A1, Off;')

Action.Name: Now press A2 on and off to test

Macro.Action: EventGhost.ShowOSD(u'Press A2 ON to test "ON" sequence\nPress A2 OFF to test "OFF" sequence', u'0;-48;0;0;0;700;0;0;0;0;3;2;1;34;Arial', (0, 0, 255), None, 4, (0, 0), 0, 5.0, False)

Folder.Name: Test case 5: test timers

Macro.Name: Test case 5: test timers

Action.Name: Please wait 3 seconds for all timers to expire

Macro.Action: EventGhost.ShowOSD(u'Please wait for all timers to expire', u'0;-48;0;0;0;700;0;0;0;0;3;2;1;34;Arial', (0, 0, 255), None, 4, (0, 0), 0, 3.0, False)
EventGhost.ShowOSD(u'Please wait until you see text "DONE"', u'0;-48;0;0;0;700;0;0;0;0;3;2;1;34;Arial', (0, 0, 255), None, 4, (0, 0), 0, 3.0, False)

Macro.Name: Show TimerSet
Macro.Action: Serial.Write(u'Status TimerSet 1;Status TimerSet 2;Status TimerSet 3; Status Timerset 15;')

Folder.Name: Test case 6: test variables

Macro.Name: Reset 1, increase 2
Macro.Action: EventGhost.ShowOSD(u'Var1 reached value 5:\n* var2 increased\n* var1 reset to 0', u'0;-48;0;0;0;700;0;0;0;0;3;2;1;34;Arial', (0, 0, 255), None, 4, (0, 0), 0, 3.0, False)

Macro.Name: Test VariableInc and Dec with different parameters
Test VariableClear in its different options

Action.Name: Test VariableClear in its different options
Clear without par1: default, clear all vars
Clear with par1=0: clear all variables
Check if other vars remain untouched with explicit clear

Folder.Name: Test case 7: test TransmitSettings

Action.Name: Best way to test: manually invoke the lines below with F5
Note: UserEvent 7.1/7.2 will generate an event, but that should NOT go out on IR and/or RF

Folder.Name: Test case 8: test command sourcing

Action.Name: Press A3 on to trigger first line, or send UserEvent 8.2
Next command should only result in outgoing KAKU command on RF
Next command looks like KAKU, but it is an event and should result in an Eventlist trigger
Next two commands are events and should be found in Eventlist

Folder.Name: Test what happens when user sets date back

Macro.Name: Preparation step 1: set clock to wintertime 2011.
Preparation step 2: again set clock to wintertime 2011.
Preparation step 3a: set clock to switchover date, but time just before summertime 2011.
Preparation step 3b: set clock to summertime 2011.
Now user moves date back 1 month
Now user moves date back to February
Now user moves date forward to August
ShowTime
Macro.Action: Serial.Write(u'Status ClockSetDate;Status ClockSetYear;Status ClockSetTime;Status ClockSetDOW;Status DaylightSaving;')

Folder.Name: Test case 10: test Status & SendStatus output
Test case 11: test WaitFreeRF on series or all

Macro.Name: Test case 11: test WaitFreeRF on series or all
Trigger series with various WaitFreeRF settings

Action.Name: For each setting, execute the UserEvent 11,1. While it is sending, try to frustrate by pressing a KAKU button
WaitFreeRF Off: should not be bothered by a KAKU signal
WaitFreeRF Series: should wait with first send until KAKU shuts up, but after that will keep sending
WaitFreeRF Series: should wait at each and every send for a free RF

Folder.Name: Test case 12: test VarBreak statements

Action.Name: UE 12.1: increment var1, break if equal to 3, then play sound
UE 12.2: increment var2, break if less than 3, then play sound
UE 12.3: increment var3, break if more than 3, then play sound
UE 12.4: increment var4, break if not equal to 3, then play sound

Macro.Name: Serial Port: Write Data:

Action.Name: execute these statements manually, group by group.

Macro.Action: Serial.Write(u'Status VariableSet,1; Status VariableSet,2; Status VariableSet,3; Status VariableSet,4;')

Action.Name: UE 12.1: increment var1, break if equal to 3, then play sound
Sound should play on all values, except 3
UE 12.2: increment var2, break if less than 3, then play sound
Sound should play on all values of 3 or higher
UE 12.3: increment var3, break if more than 3, then play sound
Sound should play on all values of 3 or lower
UE 12.4: increment var4, break if not equal to 3, then play sound
Sound should play on value of 3 only

Folder.Name: Test case 16: test WildCards
learn a few commands into the Harmony

Macro.Name: Set up Nodo as a repeater
Learn the following commands into the Harmony, one by one

Action.Name: Prerequisite: attach clocked Nodo on serial2, other Nodo on serial1
Instructions: manually execute each test step through F5, or do what is described if it says "manual
Now execute the following test steps:
Following steps are verified tetst cases:
Press F5: this will run all necessary preparations
Test group: use some IR and RF remotes to generate some signals
Manual: generate incoming KAKU by pressing any KAKU command from a KAKU hand unit: generates 16,22
Manual: fire any unknown IR signal into the Nodo: generates 16,18
Manual: generate incoming KAKU via IR from Harmony remote: generates 16,12
Manual: generate incoming NewKAKU via IR from Harmony remote: generates ???? (error, issue 161)
Manual: generate incoming UserEvent via IR from Harmony remote: generate 16,16
Test group: send signals from Nodo2 to Nodo1 across RF
Press F5: set communication to RF only
Press F5: Send a KAKU event from nodo2 to 1: generates no new events
Press F5: Send a NewKAKU event from nodo2 to 1: generates 16,23
Press F5: Send a UserEvent from nodo2 to 1 across IR only: generates 16,26 and 16,88
Press F5: Send a command for another unit from Nodo 2 to 1: generates 16,27
Press F5: Send an unknown hex code from Nodo 2 to 1: generates 16,28
Test group: send signals from Nodo2 to Nodo1 across IR
Press F5: set communication to IR only
Press F5: Send a KAKU event from nodo2 to 1: generates no new events
Press F5: Send a NewKAKU event from nodo2 to 1: generates ??? (error, issue 161)
Press F5: Send a UserEvent from nodo2 to 1 across IR only: generates no new events
Press F5: Send a command for another unit from Nodo 2 to 1
Press F5: set communication to IR&RF
Press F5: Send an unknown hex code from Nodo 2 to 1: generates 16,18
Press F5: Timer will be set to 0, this will generate an event immediately: generates 16,61
Press F5: Send a dummy userevent from unit5 to unit4: generates no new events
Press F5: this will simulate one full day with all sunup/sundown events: generates 16,51
Press F5: generate command for unknown unit. Unit5 should detect this as "OtherUnit": generates 16,27
Manual: disable serialport 1, then enable it again: generates 16,91
Press F5: generate unknown userevent from eventlist: generates 16,36/16/86/16,88
Press F5: generate unknown hex signal from serial: generates 16,38
Manual: short circuit one of the input ports on Nodo: generates 16,41
Press F5: set a variable: generates 16,71
Press F5: send a weird Userevent from Nodo 2 to 1: generates 16,26.
Test group: generate KAKU/NewKAKU from Eventlist
Press F5: generate SendKAKU from Eventlist: generates 16,36
Press F5: generate KAKU from Eventlist: generates 16,82
Press F5: generate SendNewKAKU from Eventlist: generates 16,36
Press F5: generate NewKAKU from Eventlist: generates 16,83
Press F5: send a KAKU event across serial (very unusual!): generates 16,32
Press F5: send a NewKAKU event across serial (very unusual!): generates 16,33
Below this line: work in progress.
Press F5: Send a SendUserEvent command fia serial
Press F5: Send a UserEvent command fia serial
Press F5: Send a KAKU command fia serial: generates nothing
Press F5: Send a NewKAKU command fia serial: generates nothing
Manual: send an unknown RF code from another handset: to be done
